message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. It's worth a lot to me, but I know it would be even more valuable to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $950,000. This is a great price considering its potential value to your business. What do you think?

Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value you place on this product. However, given my budget constraints, I am only able to consider offers within the range of $700,000 to $800,000. I believe this is a fair reflection of the product's worth to me. I look forward to your response.

Bob, I understand your constraints.  While I value the product at a higher level, I'm willing to be flexible to find common ground. I can't go as low as $750,000, but I'm prepared to offer it to you for $850,000. This represents a significant discount from my initial offer and a good price point for you. I hope this is a fair offer we can agree on.

Alice, thank you for your willingness to negotiate. Considering the value I place on the product and my financial situation, I propose an offer of $800,000. This is a fair compromise between our positions and I believe it reflects the true value of the product to me. I hope this proposal will be acceptable to you.
